intro: Jaborosa leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Jaborosa leptophylla is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
